_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Inspection of liquid chlorine unloading hose.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Jefferson Smurfit Corporation (U.S.), Fernandina Beach Mill, is committed to operating and maintaining all processes involving hazardous chemicals in a safe and responsible manner.  A combination of accidental release prevention programs, emergency response planning programs and coordination with knowledgeable employees to perform process hazard analyses (PHAs) and other applicable plans are employed to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public, as well as protection of the environment.  This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented to meet the Risk Management Program (RMP) requirements found in 40 CFR 68.

Chlorine is the only substance on-site at or above the threshold quantity for an RMP regulated substance.  The Chlorine System is also an OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) covered process.  The maximum on-site quantity of chlorine (180,000 lbs) exceeds the EPA¿s RMP threshold quantity of 2500 lbs and requires a worst-case release scenario analysis.  A  Program 3 Prevention Program has been developed and is based on the PSM program defined in 29 CFR 1910.119. 

Management - 40 CFR 68.15
The Fernandina Beach mill is a Program 3 RMP facility. Therefore, a management system has been designed to implement the elements of the RMP program as required by 40 CFR 68.15.  Qualified personnel or their designee(s) have been tasked with the responsibility to develop, implement, and integrate elements of this program.

Review and Update ¿ 40 CFR 68.36
The Fernandina Beach mill reviews and updates the plan every five (5) years or as needed.

Documentation - 40 CFR 68.200
Records supporting the implementation of the PSM/RMP plan are maintained as required by the regulation and JSC policy.

Five Year Accident History - 40 CFR 68.42
The Fernandina Beach mill maintains records for all significant accidental chemical releases that occur.  The five year accident history will be maintain

ed by updating the data in the five-year history log as soon as possible but within six months of the date of the accident.  At the time of an update for a new accident, if there are accidents listed in the log that occurred more than five years before the date of the update they will be removed from the five-year history.  These old accident records will not be retained.  There have been no incidents of chlorine releases within the last 5 years. 


1.	PROGRAM 3 PREVENTION PROGRAM

The Fernandina Beach Mill has established a Program 3 Prevention Program as part of the RMP.  This program is implemented via the Process Safety Management program for the Chlorine Process.  Applicable elements are found in the PSM/RMP Policy Manual and in the PSM/RMP Chlorine System Manual.  RMP program requirements and the equivalent Process Safety Management element are outlined as follows;
Process Safety Information 40 CFR 68.65 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(d)
Process Hazard Analysis 40 CFR 68.67 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(e)
Operating Procedures 40 CFR 68.69 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(f)
Training 40 CFR 68.71 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(g)
Mechanical Integrity 40 CFR 68.73 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(j)
Management of Change 40 CFR 68.75 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(l)
Pre-Startup Safety Review 40 CFR 68.77 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(i)
Compliance  Audits 40 CFR 68.79 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(o)
Incident Investigation 40 CFR 68.81 is addressed by the PSM program defined in 29 CFR 1910.119(m)
Employee Participation 40 CFR 68.83 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 19

10.119(c)
Hot Work Permits 40 CFR 68.85 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(k)
Contractors 40 CFR 68.87 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(h)
Trade Secrets 40 CFR 68.150(d) is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(p)
Emergency Planning 40 CFR 68.95 is addressed by the PSM program developed in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119(n)

      4.     EMERGENCY RESPONSE

Emergency Response Program
The Fernandina Beach Mill has implemented an emergency response program to protect public health and the environment.  The Mill¿s Emergency Action Plan that is maintained by the Safety Department addresses these elements.

      5.    OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Record Keeping - 40 CFR 68.200
Records supporting the implementation of the PSM/RMP plan are maintained as required by the regulation and JSC corporate policy.

Availability of Information - 40 CFR 68.210
The RMP that is required under subpart G of 40 CFR 68 is available to JSC employees, contractors, and the public for review.

Audits - 40 CFR 68.220
The information in this element provides guidance to implementing agencies for the selection of stationary sources and the performance of RMP adequacy audits.  JSC will respond to their requests upon receipt.
